explanation: having a lot of money or owning a lot of things
sentence: We live in an affluent neighborhood.
sentence_gap: We live in an ________ neighborhood.

explanation: to prevent further disagreement in arguments or war by giving to the opposing side an advantage that they have demanded
sentence: She claimed that the government had only changed the law in order to appease their critics.
sentence_gap: She claimed that the government had only changed the law in order to _______ their critics.

explanation: feeling worried about something that you are going to do or that is going to happen
sentence: I've invited a lot of people to the party, but I'm a little apprehensive that no one will come.
sentence_gap: I've invited a lot of people to the party, but I'm a little ____________ that no one will come.

explanation: formal; a collection of things or a group of people or animals
sentence: A varied assemblage of birds was probing the mud for food.
sentence_gap: A varied __________ of birds was probing the mud for food.

explanation: formal; the quality of being boring, ordinary, and not original, or something that is like this
sentence: What's on show in this programme is the sheer banality of ordinary lives.
sentence_gap: What's on show in this programme is the sheer ________ of ordinary lives.

explanation: the hard outer covering of a tree
sentence: All mature eucalypts put on an annual layer of bark, which contributes to the increasing diameter of the stems.
sentence_gap: All mature eucalypts put on an annual layer of ____, which contributes to the increasing diameter of the stems.

explanation: earlier (than a particular time)
sentence: I knew she was coming that afternoon because she had phoned beforehand to say so.
sentence_gap: I knew she was coming that afternoon because she had phoned __________ to say so.

explanation: coming later than expected
sentence: They did make a belated attempt to reduce the noise.
sentence_gap: They did make a _______ attempt to reduce the noise.

explanation: to show something to be false, or to hide something such as an emotion
sentence: Her calm face belied the terror she was feeling.
sentence_gap: Her calm face ______ the terror she was feeling.

explanation: very bright and hot; powerful and impressive
sentence: We quickly grew tired in the blazing sunshine.
sentence_gap: We quickly grew tired in the _______ sunshine.

explanation: to move or make something move quickly up and down, especially in water
sentence: Tiny boats bobbed up and down in the harbor.
sentence_gap: Tiny boats ______ up and down in the harbor.

explanation: a hole in the ground dug by an animal such as a rabbit, especially to live in
sentence: The chipmunk retreated to its burrow to have its babies.
sentence_gap: The chipmunk retreated to its ______ to have its babies.

explanation: UK; someone who sings, plays, or performs in a public place so that people will give money
sentence: A busker was playing violin on the train platform.
sentence_gap: A ______ was playing violin on the train platform.

explanation: the state of not having sexual relationships or never having had sex
sentence: As a monk, he took vows of chastity, poverty, and obedience.
sentence_gap: As a monk, he took vows of ________, poverty, and obedience.

explanation: to come together to form a single thing or group; to join two or more things or groups together to form a single one
sentence: Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.
sentence_gap: Hydrogen and oxygen _______ to form water.

explanation: a sudden, short period of noise, confusion, or excited movement
sentence: He looked up to see what all the commotion was about.
sentence_gap: He looked up to see what all the _________ was about.

explanation: one of the separate areas inside a vehicle, especially a train
sentence: The first class compartment is at the front of the train.
sentence_gap: The first class ___________ is at the front of the train.

explanation: formal; a substance, such as salt, that you add to food to improve its taste
sentence: Cinnamon is principally employed in cookery as a condiment and flavoring material, being largely used in the preparation of some kinds of chocolate and liqueurs.
sentence_gap: Cinnamon is principally employed in cookery as a _________ and flavoring material, being largely used in the preparation of some kinds of chocolate and liqueurs.

explanation: a group of people who have come together in a religious building for worship and prayer
sentence: The priest asked the congregation to kneel.
sentence_gap: The priest asked the ____________ to kneel.

explanation: to make someone believe something that is not true
sentence: He's deluding himself if he thinks he's going to be promoted this year.
sentence_gap: He's ________ himself if he thinks he's going to be promoted this year.

explanation: formal; to express disagreement or refuse to do something
sentence: The lawyer requested a break in the court case, but the judge demurred.
sentence_gap: The lawyer requested a break in the court case, but the judge ________.

explanation: connected with a god, or like a god
sentence: Some fans seem to regard the players as divine beings.
sentence_gap: Some fans seem to regard the players as ______ beings.

explanation: to make something secret known
sentence: Journalists do not divulge their sources.
sentence_gap: Journalists do not _______ their sources.

explanation: to feel extremely worried or frightened about something that is going to happen or that might happen
sentence: He's dreading the exam - he's sure he's going to fail.
sentence_gap: He's ________ the exam - he's sure he's going to fail.

explanation: disapproving; boring and making you feel unhappy
sentence: She had spent another dreary day in the office.
sentence_gap: She had spent another ______ day in the office.

explanation: formal; causing a wrong act to be judged less seriously by giving reasons for it
sentence: She was found guilty of theft, but because of extenuating circumstances was not sent to prison.
sentence_gap: She was found guilty of theft, but because of ___________ circumstances was not sent to prison.

explanation: a long, sharp tooth of an animal such as a dog or a snake
sentence: The dog growled and bared its fangs.
sentence_gap: The dog growled and bared its _____.

explanation: (something that causes) difficult or unpleasant conditions of life, or an example of this
sentence: People suffered many hardships during that long winter.
sentence_gap: People suffered many _________ during that long winter.

explanation: a strange or unusual habit, way of behaving, or feature that someone or something has
sentence: She often cracks her knuckles when she's speaking - it's one of her little idiosyncrasies.
sentence_gap: She often cracks her knuckles when she's speaking - it's one of her little ______________.

explanation: coming or likely to happen very soon
sentence: For a man in imminent danger of losing his job, he appeared quite unruffled.
sentence_gap: For a man in ________ danger of losing his job, he appeared quite unruffled.

explanation: something that encourages a particular activity or makes that activity more energetic or effective
sentence: The recent publicity surrounding homelessness has given fresh impetus to the cause.
sentence_gap: The recent publicity surrounding homelessness has given fresh _______ to the cause.

explanation: formal; happening or done at a time that is not suitable or convenient
sentence: I'm sorry, you've called at an inopportune moment.
sentence_gap: I'm sorry, you've called at an ___________ moment.

explanation: very kind and generous towards an enemy or someone you have defeated
sentence: The team's manager was magnanimous in victory, and praised the losing team.
sentence_gap: The team's manager was ___________ in victory, and praised the losing team.

explanation: temporary and of low quality, but used because of a sudden need
sentence: Thousands of refugees are living in makeshift camps.
sentence_gap: Thousands of refugees are living in _________ camps.

explanation: the long, thick hair that grows along the top of a horse's neck or around the face and neck of a lion
sentence: The painting depicts a beautiful young man with a flowing mane of red hair.
sentence_gap: The painting depicts a beautiful young man with a flowing ____ of red hair.

explanation: literary; the responsibilities of an important position or job, especially as given from the person who had the job to the person who replaces them
sentence: She unsuccessfully attempted to assume the mantle of the presidency.
sentence_gap: She unsuccessfully attempted to assume the ______ of the presidency.

explanation: to try to change or have an influence on things that are not your responsibility, especially by criticizing in a damaging or annoying way
sentence: My sister's always meddling in other people's affairs.
sentence_gap: My sister's always ________ in other people's affairs.

explanation: literary; often changing or reacting in a way that is unexpected
sentence: Emily's mercurial temperament made her difficult to live with.
sentence_gap: Emily's _________ temperament made her difficult to live with.

explanation: very carefully, or looking at every small detail
sentence: The metal is then minutely examined to ensure there are no cracks.
sentence_gap: The metal is then ________ examined to ensure there are no cracks.

explanation: in a state of being upset, nervous, and worried
sentence: She was so tired and overwrought that she burst into tears.
sentence_gap: She was so tired and ___________ that she burst into tears.

explanation: to fall suddenly and quickly from a high level or position
sentence: Her spirits plummeted at the thought of meeting him again.
sentence_gap: Her spirits _________ at the thought of meeting him again.

explanation: informal; a dog
sentence: For one thing, there's no conflict, unless you count the tension between a guy and his untrainable pooch
sentence_gap: For one thing, there's no conflict, unless you count the tension between a guy and his untrainable _____

explanation: (usually disapproving) to spend a lot of time making yourself look attractive and then admiring your appearance
sentence: Will you stop preening yourself in front of the mirror?
sentence_gap: Will you stop ________ yourself in front of the mirror?

explanation: one of several thin, sharp points that stick out of a plant or animal
sentence: The fruit can be eaten once the prickles have been removed.
sentence_gap: The fruit can be eaten once the ________ have been removed.

explanation: a period of time when a criminal must behave well and not commit any more crimes in order to avoid being sent to prison
sentence: The judge put him on probation for two years.
sentence_gap: The judge put him on _________ for two years.

explanation: small; weak; not effective
sentence: My car only has a puny little engine.
sentence_gap: My car only has a ____ little engine.

explanation: (of a speech or piece of writing) very long and confused; (of a building) spreading in various directions with no particular pattern
sentence: They live in a rambling old house in the country.
sentence_gap: They live in a ________ old house in the country.

explanation: (of butter, oil, etc.) tasting or smelling unpleasant because of not being fresh
sentence: There was a rancid smell coming from the kitchen.
sentence_gap: There was a ______ smell coming from the kitchen.

explanation: 500 sheets of paper; informal; a lot of something, especially writing
sentence: She's written reams of poetry.
sentence_gap: She's written _____ of poetry.

explanation: formal; using something or someone as a way of getting help, especially in a difficult or dangerous situation
sentence: It is hoped that the dispute will be settled without recourse to litigation.
sentence_gap: It is hoped that the dispute will be settled without ________ to litigation.

explanation: literary; to tear or break something violently
sentence: They rent their clothes in grief.
sentence_gap: They ____ their clothes in grief.

explanation: formal; having a good effect on someone or something, though often seeming unpleasant
sentence: The accident was a salutary reminder of the dangers of climbing.
sentence_gap: The accident was a ________ reminder of the dangers of climbing.

explanation: disapproving; believing that you are more important or have a higher value than other people
sentence: He never comes across as pompous or self-important.
sentence_gap: He never comes across as pompous or ______________.

explanation: exactly the same
sentence: His father had suffered from the selfsame disease.
sentence_gap: His father had suffered from the ________ disease.

explanation: the front part of your leg between your knee and your foot
sentence: She has a nasty bruise on her shin.
sentence_gap: She has a nasty bruise on her ____.

explanation: (especially of dogs) to make a deep, rough sound while showing the teeth, usually in anger or (of people) to speak or say something angrily and forcefully
sentence: The dogs started to snarl at each other so I had to separate them.
sentence_gap: The dogs started to _____ at each other so I had to separate them.

explanation: a small, sharp, broken piece of wood, glass, plastic, or similar material
sentence: The girl had a splinter of wood in her toe.
sentence_gap: The girl had a ________ of wood in her toe.

explanation: to partly close your eyes in order to see more clearly
sentence: The sun was shining straight in her eyes and made her squint.
sentence_gap: The sun was shining straight in her eyes and made her ______.

explanation: surprising and sometimes worrying
sentence: He made some startling admissions about his past.
sentence_gap: He made some _________ admissions about his past.

explanation: literary; a horse that is ridden
sentence: I spurred my panting steed and waved my sword.
sentence_gap: I spurred my panting _____ and waved my sword.

explanation: to shock or surprise someone very much
sentence: News of the disaster stunned people throughout the world.
sentence_gap: News of the disaster _______ people throughout the world.

explanation: (of a person) to feel very hot; to be very hot in a way that makes you feel uncomfortable
sentence: The soldiers were sweltering in their uniforms.
sentence_gap: The soldiers were __________ in their uniforms.

explanation: real and not imaginary; able to be shown, touched, or experienced
sentence: We need tangible evidence if we're going to take legal action.
sentence_gap: We need ________ evidence if we're going to take legal action.

explanation: to rain heavily
sentence: It's been teeming down all day.
sentence_gap: It's been _______ down all day.

explanation: formal; lasting for only a short time
sentence: A growing proportion of the population are in a transitory stage between paid employment and old age.
sentence_gap: A growing proportion of the population are in a __________ stage between paid employment and old age.

explanation: (of light or a shiny surface) to shine repeatedly strongly then weakly, as if flashing on and off very quickly
sentence: The lights of the town twinkled in the distance.
sentence_gap: The lights of the town ________ in the distance.

explanation: total, or expressed in a clear and certain way
sentence: The church has been unequivocal in its condemnation of the violence.
sentence_gap: The church has been ___________ in its condemnation of the violence.

explanation: likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly, especially by getting worse
sentence: Food and fuel prices are very volatile in a war situation.
sentence_gap: Food and fuel prices are very ________ in a war situation.

explanation: a slight smell, carried on a current of air
sentence: He leaned towards me and I caught a whiff of garlic.
sentence_gap: He leaned towards me and I caught a _____ of garlic.

explanation: to twist your body, or move part of your body, with small, quick movements
sentence: A large worm wriggled in the freshly dug earth.
sentence_gap: A large worm ________ in the freshly dug earth.
